Identification.ShortTitle: Materials for the Use of the Blind Regulations
Identification.LongTitle: Regulations Respecting the Conditions Under Which Materials for the Use of the Blind may be Sent by Post Free of Postage

Section.Text: These Regulations may be cited as the Materials for the Use of the Blind Regulations.
The following definitions apply in these Regulations.

Definition.Text: material for the use of the blind means

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: matter impressed in Braille or similar raised type;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: plates for manufacturing matter described in paragraph (a),

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: tapes, records and other sound recordings posted by the blind in Canada; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: tapes, records, other sound recordings and special paper intended solely for the use of the blind if mailed by or addressed to a recognized institution for the blind. (documentation à l’usage des aveugles)

Definition.Text: postage means the charge payable for the handling and conveyance of material for the use of the blind. (affranchissement)

Section.Text: Material for the use of the blind sent by post in Canada may be sent free of postage if

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the combined length, width and depth of the material does not exceed 2 m with the greatest measurement not exceeding 1 m, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the material is not less than 10 cm in length and 7 cm in width;

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the combined length, width and depth of the material does not exceed 90 cm with the greatest measurement not exceeding 60 cm, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the material is not less than 14 cm in length and 9 cm in width.

Section.Text: The maximum weight of any item of material for the use of the blind that may be sent by post under these Regulations is 7 kg.

Subsection.Text: Every item of material for the use of the blind shall, if for delivery in Canada,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: by means of marking, printing or labelling, bear the words “Literature for the blind” or “Documentation à l’usage des aveugles” in the upper right corner on the address side of the item; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: bear on the address side of the item a label in a form approved by the Corporation.

Subsection.Text: Every item of material for the use of the blind shall, if for delivery outside of Canada,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: by means of marking, printing or labelling, bear the words “Cécogrammes” or “Cécogrammes (Literature for the blind)” in the upper right corner on the address side of the item; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: bear on the address side of the item a label in a form approved by the Corporation.

Subsection.Text: Every item referred to in subsection (2) shall meet all applicable customs documentation requirements as described in the International Letter-Post Items Regulations.
Every item of material for the use of the blind shall be prepared for posting in such a way that its contents are sufficiently protected while permitting quick and easy verification.
Every item of material for the use of the blind shall be accepted for registered mail or, in Canada, XpresspostTM mail at no charge.
